item.title: Using Python to Wrangle and Visualize Data
item.description: Though I am most familiar with R, Python is another language that is quite useful when organizing and analyzing data. Here, I use the infamous ‘iris’ dataset to demonstrate some basic data analysis functionalities of Python. When doing data wrangling, Python’s pandas package is a commendable alternative for R’s tidyverse and dplyr packages. Below, I use some basic pandas functions to determine the mean and standard deviation for the sepal and petal width and length of each iris species.
